bg.x2d.anim
Interface Segment

All Known Implementing Classes:
ComboSegment, CurveSegment, DilationSegment, RotationSegment, TranslationSegment
public interface Segment

Defines methods for Segments of an Animation. Each Segment is called asynchronously, but is expected to perform cumulative operations (per millisecond). Subclasses should make sure to handle time standings accurately and take into account loss of time with each call (difference * increment).

Since:
2DX 1.0 (1st Edition)
Author:
Brian Groenke

Field Summary
static int INTERVAL_UNDEF
          Value returned by getUpdateInterval if the Segment has no defined update interval.
Constant value = -1
 
Method Summary

          Fetches the time duration of this Segment.

          Gets the update increment value for each millisecond of time.
 boolean isStarted()
          Checks to see if this Segment has been started (if transform has been called.
 boolean isValid()
          Checks to see if this Segment has completed or not (valid if not completed, not valid otherwise).
 void reset()
          Resets the time variables of this Segment so that it becomes valid and ready to be started again.
 void transform(AffineTransform affine, Transform transform)
          Performs this Segment's cumulative operations on this AffineTransform since the last call.
 

Field Detail

INTERVAL_UNDEF

static final int INTERVAL_UNDEF
Value returned by getUpdateInterval if the Segment has no defined update interval.
Constant value = -1

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getDuration

long getDuration()
Fetches the time duration of this Segment.

Returns:
the time duration in milliseconds.

getUpdateInterval

double getUpdateInterval()
Gets the update increment value for each millisecond of time. For Segments that use more than one interval (x and y for instance), this method will return some sort of combination between the two (average, hypotenuse, etc).

Returns:
the interval value for each milisecond of time in this Segment or INTERVAL_UNDEF if undefined.

transform

void transform(AffineTransform affine,
               Transform transform)
Performs this Segment's cumulative operations on this AffineTransform since the last call. If this Segment has been completed and is no longer valid, this method does nothing.

Parameters:
affine -
transform - data for ongoing transformations

isStarted

boolean isStarted()
Checks to see if this Segment has been started (if transform has been called.

Returns:
true if started, false otherwise.

isValid

boolean isValid()
Checks to see if this Segment has completed or not (valid if not completed, not valid otherwise).

Returns:
true if this Segment hasn't been started or is in progress, false otherwise.

reset

void reset()
Resets the time variables of this Segment so that it becomes valid and ready to be started again.
